text: Charles Burgess Fry (most commonly known as C. B. Fry; 25 April 1872 â€“ 7 September 1956) is a former sportsman. He played cricket and football for England. He played in an FA Cup Final. Fry held a world record for long jump for many years. He also played rugby union. Later in his life, he was a writer and diplomat. He was asked to become king of Albania, but refused it. ==International career statistics== |- |1901||1||0 |- !Total||1||0 |} ==References== Category:1872 births Category:1956 deaths Category:English and Welsh cricketers Category:English footballers Category:English rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from London Category:People from Croydon Category:Portsmouth F.C. players Category:Royal Navy officers Category:Southampton F.C. players
